node.title: Geography Brought Them Closer Together
node.alt: Tai Leclaire, left, and Dominic Tetro.
node.description: Tai Leclaire and Dominic Tetro met through the dating app OkCupid in 2014 and got to know each other through a geography quiz.
node.content: ["When Taietsar\u00f3n:sere Leclaire, who goes by Tai, and Dominic Tetro went to dinner together for the first time seven years ago, Mr. Leclaire declared that he was going to eat his burger with a knife and fork. The couple also began a geography competition.", "It was a \u201cgetting to know you\u201d exercise as well as a cross-cultural foray, at the Black Swan, an English-style pub in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Bedford-Stuyvesant.", "\u201cHe grew up in Canada, and tried to name all of the 50 states,\u201d Mr. Tetro said, adding that Mr. Leclaire did pretty well. \u201cI tried to name all the provinces and territories of Canada, which I still don\u2019t know.\u201d", "A few days before their first dinner, the couple had a first date: they met for drinks at Dynaco, a bar in Bedford-Stuyvesant, in July 2014 after connecting through the dating app OkCupid.", "\u201cThe date was great,\u201d said Mr. Leclaire, 32. \u201cI had an old fashioned. He had a negroni.\u201d But Mr. Leclaire, who had just finished moving, was worn out. The date was over in under an hour.", "Then came the dinner with the geography quiz, and then a third date, on the waterfront in Williamsburg, that culminated with a first kiss on a park bench.", "Mr. Leclaire \u201cmade the first move because I was too scared to,\u201d said Mr. Tetro, 34. \u201cHe\u2019s definitely very passionate, driven and focused. He pushes me to be better. I\u2019m a very, just, like \u2014 lazy is not the right word \u2014 but sometimes I\u2019m just like, \u2018Eh.\u2019 He helps me get to the next step in my life.\u201d", "That next step in their relationship came around Halloween, when Mr. Leclaire\u2019s parents were planning to visit and Mr. Tetro said he wanted to be positioned as \u201cboyfriend.\u201d The introduction took place at the Black Swan. When Mr. Tetro\u2019s family came to visit in early 2015, they all met, again, at the Black Swan.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "The two men were engaged in 2019, planned a wedding for Oct. 10, 2020, and then postponed because of the coronavirus pandemic.", "In April 2021, they moved to Los Angeles, where Mr. Leclaire, an actor and comedian, had lived briefly before, when he accepted a TV writing job. ", "\u201cBeing someone who is trying to work in entertainment and TV, he\u2019s always been there, someone I\u2019m not afraid to complain to,\u201d Mr. Leclaire said of Mr. Tetro. \u201cI once had a show where he was the only person in the audience and was so excited that he was the only person there.\u201d", "Mr. Leclaire, who received a diploma in professional photography from Dawson College in Montreal, and a bachelor\u2019s degree in communication design from the Parsons School of Design, is now a writer for \u201cRutherford Falls,\u201d a series on NBC\u2019s streaming network, Peacock. Mr. Tetro, who graduated from the New York Institute of Technology, is an architectural designer in the Los Angeles office of Interior Architects.", "On Oct. 23, the couple married at Kester Homestead, a wedding venue in Memphis, N.Y., that is on traditional Iroquois land, which mattered to Mr. Leclaire, who is a member of the Kahnaw\u00e1:ke Mohawk Nation. Brittany Griffin, a Universal Life minister, officiated before about 100 guests. The couple asked attendees to get vaccinated before the event, which took place mostly outdoors.", "\u201cDom\u2019s the person I can relax with,\u201d Mr. Leclaire said. \u201cI can be anxious, I can be high-strung, a little precious about the words I use, and, with Dom, it\u2019s just like pajamas on the couch. And it\u2019s great.\u201d"]
